meanings.definition: A plan or course of action taken in case of failure or setback.
meanings.sent1: She always has fallbacks in place in case her original plan doesn't work out.
meanings.sent2: Having a list of fallbacks is essential for any project to ensure success.
meanings.sent3: When her cake collapsed, she had to resort to her fallbacks to salvage the situation.
meanings.sent4: His fallbacks were like a safety net, ready to catch him if things went wrong.
meanings.sent5: The fallbacks were like a secret weapon, waiting to be deployed when needed most.

meanings.definition: Something that can be relied on in an emergency or when other options are unavailable.
meanings.sent1: In times of crisis, having reliable fallbacks can make all the difference.
meanings.sent2: His experience and knowledge were his fallbacks when facing unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella was his fallbacks on a rainy day, always there to keep him dry.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was a fallbacks, a constant source of support and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight became his fallbacks in the darkness, guiding his way to safety.
